key_insight: DREX dynamically regroup batches at inference time so tokens/requests that are ready to exit early do so without forcing the whole batch to wait or degrade quality â€” unlocking the efficiency of Early-Exit LLMs while preserving accuracy.
problem_solved: Traditional batching frameworks assume synchronous exits and either block EE opportunities or force premature exits, causing wasted compute, higher latency, or lower output quality for Early-Exit LLMs.
method: Continuously monitor per-token/request exit readiness and extract exit candidates as they become available.
Form new micro-batches for remaining layers by rebatching only the unfinished tokens/requests, using a low-overhead scheduler to balance throughput and latency.
Integrate with existing hardware batching stacks to minimize reshuffling overhead while preserving model accuracy (no forced early terminations).
impact: DREX increases utilization and reduces end-to-end latency and compute cost for EE-enabled LLM inference, making real-world deployment of early-exit models more practical for latency-sensitive and cost-constrained services.

paper_title: Dynamic Rebatching for Efficient Early-Exit Inference with DREX
paper_authors: Xuting Liu, Daniel Alexander, Siva Kesava Reddy Kakarla, Behnaz Arzani, Vincent Liu
